Reference: Gene signature (built-in from scRNA-seq), List of marker genes
Method.name: SpaCET

Reference: Gene signature (built-in from scRNA-seq), scRNA-seq dataset
Method.name: AntiSplodge

Reference: scRNA-seq dataset, List of marker genes
Method.name: ST-assign
GIST
Image.integration: Uses the image data to generate a prior estimate of the abundance of some cell type at each spot

Method.name: RedeHist
Image.integration: Applies U-net on image patches to extract pixel-level histological features and then combines it with nucleus masks tensor to generate patch-level features. With the help of sc and ST data, it generates a predicted expression matrix for single cells.

Method.name: SpaDecon
ST.coordinates.integration: They combine it with histology image to smooth GE data.
Image.integration: They combine it with spatial location to smooth GE data.

Method.name: stereoscope
ST.coordinates.integration: Location specific scaling parameter

Method.name: SONAR
ST.coordinates.integration: Weighted kernel function decaying with distance

Method.name: SpaTrio
ST.coordinates.integration: KNN graph

Method.name: scDOT
ST.coordinates.integration: KNN graph

Method.name: STEM
ST.coordinates.integration: They convert the coordinates into a normalized spatial adjacency matrix. This matrix is used as a ground truth. To predict ST spatial adjacency matrix, they use ST embeddings from the spatial information extracting module.

Method.name: SpatialDDLS
ST.coordinates.integration: The transcriptional profile of the surroundings of each spot are used to spatially regularize the original predicted proportions in the spot.

Method.name: SD2
ST.coordinates.integration: Spatial graph, Adjacency matrix

Method.name: CellTrek
ST.coordinates.integration: Train multivariate RF with [X,Y] ~ PCs

Method.name: SpatialPrompt
ST.coordinates.integration: Weighted mean expression with neighbors spots

Method.name: DOT
ST.coordinates.integration: They introduce optional constraints related to the similarity of expressions in neighboring spatial locations of spots as well as prior knowledge in the form of the expected abundance of cell populations.

Method.name: NovoSpaRc
ST.coordinates.integration: The user chooses a number of neighbors to use for constructing the kNN graphs over cells and locations. Then, the location-location cost matrix is created.

Reference: Gene signature (built-in from scRNA-seq), scRNA-seq dataset
Method.name: STdGCN
ST.coordinates.integration: Spatial graph based on Euclidian distance

Method.name: GNNDeconvolver
ST.coordinates.integration: Spatial graph, Adjacency matrix

Method.name: GraphST
ST.coordinates.integration: KNN graph, Adjacency matrix

Method.name: EnDecon
ST.coordinates.integration: Depending on method

Method.name: MAST-Decon
ST.coordinates.integration: It is part of the model : the weight function contains a term that characterizes the similarities between two spots. They also take into account a parameter r, the radius to determine how many neighboring spots should be used in calculating the weighted log-likelihood.
Image.integration: Use of a kernel to measure how much the spots differ in terms of histological features based on embedded feature vectors. They add this kernel to the location-associated kernel and the ST-associated kernel present in the weight function.

Method.name: POLARIS
ST.coordinates.integration: Layer-specific parameter (mean shift in distribution model)
Image.integration: Feature extraction with masked autoencoder (MAE) from facebook/mae for spot and neighborhood. Then built an image network that combined two levels of fully connected layers and give as output the number of cell types.

Method.name: Cell2location
ST.coordinates.integration: Location specific scaling parameter, hierarchical decomposition prior
Image.integration: Segmentation to give prior to model

Method.name: SpatialScope
ST.coordinates.integration: They assume a prior given by the Potts model for cell types. The prior contains a parameter that controls the spatial smoothness of cell type labels.

Method.name: Cottrazm
ST.coordinates.integration: Normalization of data, Manhattan and Euclidian distance
Image.integration: Normalization with SME methodology after retrieving spot counts and feature extraction with ResNet50/ImageNet ("morphologically adjusted gene expression matrix").

Method.name: SPADE
ST.coordinates.integration: Spatial clustering with SpaGCN
Image.integration: Spatial clustering with SpaGCN integrates image

Method.name: LETSmix
ST.coordinates.integration: They construct an adjacency matrix that aggregates information from neighboring spots to remove noise due to limited cell numbers in each spot (spatial refinement for ST data).
Image.integration: Integrates histology and combines it with spatial location and annotations to create an adjacency matrix reflecting internal correlations between spots.

Method.name: Tangram
ST.coordinates.integration: Voxelize the spatial volume at the finest possible resolution and index the voxels in an arbitrary one-dimensional fashion. The main output is a matrix denoting the probability of finding each cell from the sc/snRNA-seq data in each voxel. They propose an optional entropy regularizer to minimize the entropy of the spatial distribution of each cell.
Image.integration: For segmentation (with ilastik and nucleAIzer). They use it to estimate cell number within each spot.

Method.name: scResolve
Image.integration: Pixel-level gene expression inference with Xfuse from the image, cell segmentation.

Method.name: CellPie
Image.integration: NMF on the image matrices. It is computed jointly with NMF on ST data (they share the same W matrix).

Method.name: Celloscope
Image.integration: Segmentation to give prior to model and eventually domains

Method.name: TransformerST
ST.coordinates.integration: Formation of a spot-to-spot correlation graph. The adaptive graph transformer approach identifies tissue types by amalgamating spatial gene expression, spatial relationships and histology images, while also employing an adaptive parameter learning step to explore better the relationship between spatial gene features and graph neighboring dependence.
Image.integration: The histology image is used to extract morphological features with a Vision Transformer. It allows to capture complex structureâ€“functional relationships.

Method.name: FAST
ST.coordinates.integration: Adjacency matrix, Graph laplacian matrix
Image.integration: Compute euclidian distance of histology images by measuring the difference in median internsities over sub-regions in grey scale. Sub-regions can be tailored by users (here they use 5-by-5 squre and 25 spots).

Method.name: TESLA
ST.coordinates.integration: Weighted aggregation, 10-NN based on Euclidian distance
Image.integration: Superpixel generation of size 50x50(default), aggregation of expression of neighboring spots and go through CNN

Reference: List of marker genes (built-in from ST and/or provided)
Method.name: Starfysh
Image.integration: Integrates histology to correct for artifacts in transcriptomic measurements. A product of experts calculates the joint posterior distribution for gene expression and images.

Method.name: STIE
Image.integration: Extract information from nuclear morphology-based cell typing to refine gene expression-based cell type proportion estimation

Method.name: BayesTME
ST.coordinates.integration: Spatial smoothing hyperparameter,

Method.name: MUSTANG
ST.coordinates.integration: Adjacency matrix

Reference: Gene signature (built-in from scRNA-seq), List of marker genes
Method.name: CARD
ST.coordinates.integration: Conditional autoregressive model, Spatial autocorrelation
